sentence.Network_en: Back in his room, Raskolnikov received a summons from the police.
sentence.Network_cn: 拉斯柯尔尼科夫刚回到自己房里就接到了警方的传票.

sentence.Network_en: Svidrigailov, having overheard the confession, disclosed his knowledge to Raskolnikov.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯维德里加依洛夫偷听了这番话, 又向拉斯柯尔尼科夫透露自己知道真情.

sentence.Network_en: Raskolnikov hid the jewelry under a rock in a courtyard.
sentence.Network_cn: 拉斯柯尔尼科夫把珠宝藏在院子里的一块石头下面.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 少年学生拉科尼科夫(Raskolnikov)走进酒店，方吸啤酒，有一人同他攀谈，年纪五十以上，身穿破衣，已经半醉，却曾受过教育。此 …

means.word_mean: 1. a fictional character in Dostoevsky's novel `Crime and Punishment'; he kills old women because he believes he is beyond the bounds of good or evil
